verdict.summary: A cluster worker disconnected unexpectedly from the master process, usually due to an unhandled exception, memory exhaustion, or explicit disconnect call before the server was ready.

dead_ends.action: Calling cluster.disconnect() before workers have fully initialized
dead_ends.why_fails: Workers that haven't bound to a port yet will silently fail to clean up, leaving orphaned connections

dead_ends.action: Using process.exit() in workers instead of graceful shutdown
dead_ends.why_fails: Abrupt exit drops in-flight requests and can corrupt shared state or IPC channels

workarounds.action: Listen for 'disconnect' and 'exit' events on the cluster and fork replacement workers
Implement graceful shutdown with server.close() before disconnecting
workarounds.how: In the worker: server.close(() => { process.disconnect(); }); â€” ensures all connections drain before exiting

leads_to.condition: when a replacement worker tries to bind a port still held by the exiting worker

preceded_by.condition: when OOM kills a cluster worker

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Cluster disconnect involves child processes communicating via IPC, while worker thread crashes involve threads sharing memory within a single process
